attributes.action: Bring suger filled vending machines back
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I am a student studying a-levels. Contradictory to common views, this is a long and hard process. After doing revision, homework and extra reading during a private study session I thought I deserved a brake. However I was faced with an empty vending machine. Further work was almost impossible to complete on an empty stomach and low sugar levels.

I understand this move is popular for lower schools, and in part, i agree with that. But to remove sugar from vending machines within a 6th form only block is outrageous. I am not trusted to make a decision about my health at the age of 17. I am fit and healthy and I attend my local gym. Why should I be denied the right to a "treat" after hard work. After all most revision plans tell you to have a sugary snack to help you continue studying.
